identificationModule.briefTitle: The MRI-based Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of EVT and SMT: A Retrospective, Multicenter Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: The MRI-based Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of EVT and SMT: A Retrospective, Multicenter Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Acute Basilar Artery Occlusion (ABAO), a condition with a high risk of mortality or disability (up to 80%). The safety and efficacy of endovascular thrombectomy (EVT) in ABAO remains uncertain due to inconsistent evidence from random controlled trials (RCTs).

Recent studies have explored the use of MRI in ABAO, this study aims to assess the efficacy and safety of EVT and standard medical therapy (SMT) in the treatment of ABAO within 24 hours of onset. It also aims to explore the feasibility and prognostic value of MRI-based assessment of ABAO infarction using AI image analysis software.

armGroups.label: Endovascular Thrombectomy
armGroups.description: For patients who onset within 4.5 hours and meet the criteria for intravenous thrombolysis treatment, they could receive intravenous thrombolysis treatment beforehand and bridging to endovascular therapy.

armGroups.label: Standard Medical Therapy
armGroups.description: For patients who onset within 4.5 hours and met the criteria for intravenous thrombolysis treatment, recombinant tissue plasminogen activator (rt-PA) or urokinase, and other intravenous thrombolysis therapies should be pre-administrated.

interventions.name: Mechanical Thrombectomy
interventions.description: The endovascular mechanical thrombectomy methods mainly include stent retriever thrombectomy, ADAPT thrombus aspiration technique, or their combination.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score of 0-3 at 90 days
primaryOutcomes.description: The mRS score range from 0 (no disability) to 6 (death)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Death defined as a mRS score of 6
The mRS score range from 0 (no disability) to 6 (death)

The mRS score range from 0 (no disability) to 6 (death)

The mRS score range from 0 (no disability) to 6 (death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change of the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score comparing to baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: The NIHSS score range from 0 (no deficit) to 42 (maximum deficit).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 24 hours and 5-7 days (or at discharge) after EVT

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of successful revascularization (mTICI 2b-3) in target blood vessels of EVT group
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately after the completion of endovascular therapy.
Within 72 hours after EVT or SMT

secondaryOutcomes.description: The sICH was assessed based on the Heidelberg Bleeding Classification, defined as 1) ≥4 points total NIHSS at the time of diagnosis compared to immediately before worsening; 2) ≥2 point in one NIHSS category. The rationale for this is to capture new hemorrhages that produce new neurological symptoms, making them clearly symptomatic but not causing worsening in the original stroke territory; 3) Leading to intubation/hemicraniectomy/EVD placement or other major medical/surgical intervention; 4) Absence of alternative explanation for deterioration.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 72 hours after EVT or SMT

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of non-hemorrhage severe adverse event
secondaryOutcomes.description: ulmonary infection, respiratory failure, heart failure, myocardial infarction, urinary infection, etc.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 72 hours after EVT or SMT

secondaryOutcomes.description: Vascular perforation, arterial dissection, arterial embolism, or distal embolism, etc.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 72 hours after EVT or SMT

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: From January 2020 to September 2022, ABAO patients at Xuanwu Hospital Capital Medical University and 10 branch centers underwent EVT or SMT.
